metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9038 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
GNU Binutils 2.28 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted ELF file, related to the byte_get_little_endian function in elfcomm.c, the get_unwind_section_word function in readelf.c, and ARM unwind information that contains invalid word offsets.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9038` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.1

binutils-for-build - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.1

criterions.comment: binutils package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.1').
